2300470.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300470
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 001
2300470.text: Kulayb ibn Manfa'a reported that his grandfather asked, "Messenger of Allah, towards whom should I be dutiful?" He replied, "Your mother, your father, your sister and your brother. Then your mawla (client) has the next right against you and then your relatives who are connected."

2300480.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300480
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 002
2300480.text: Abu Hurayra said, "When the following ayat was revealed ('Warn your near relatives' (26:214)), the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, stood up and called out, saying, 'Banu Ka'b ibn Lu'ayy! Save yourselves from the Fire! Banu 'Abdu Manaf! Save yourselves from the Fire! Banu Hashim! Save yourselves from the Fire! Banu 'Abdu'l-Muttalib! Save yourselves from the Fire! Fatima, daughter of Muhammad! Save yourselves from the Fire! I do not have anything for you in respect to Allah except for the fact that you have ties of kinship.'"

2300490.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300490
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 003
2300490.text: Abu Ayyub al-Ansari told him that a bedouin came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, while he was travelling. He asked, "Tell me what will bring me near to the Garden and keep me far from the Fire." He replied, "Worship Allah and do not associate anything with Him, perform the prayer, pay zakat, and maintain ties of kinship."

2300500.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300500
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 004
2300500.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Allah Almighty created creation. When He had finished it, ties of kinship rose up. Allah said, 'Stop!' They said, 'This is the place for anyone seeking refuge with You from being cut off' Allah said, 'Are you not content that I should maintain connections with the one who maintains connection with you and I should cut off the one who cuts you off?' It replied, 'Yes indeed, my Lord.' He said, 'You have that.'"

2300510.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300510
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 005
2300510.text: 'Give your relatives their due, and the very poor and travellers.' He also teaches us what we can say if we have nothing. He says, 'But if you do turn away from them, seeking the mercy you hope for from your Lord, then speak to them with words that bring them ease' (17:28) in the form of an excellent promise. Things are as they are, but they might change if Allah wills. 'Do not keep your hand chained to your neck' and not give anything, 'but do not extend it either to its full extent' and give all you have, 'so that you sit there blamed' as those who come to you later and find you have nothing will blame you, 'and destitute.' (17:29)" He said, "The person to whom you have given everything has made you destitute."

2300520.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300520
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 006
2300520.text: Abu Hurayra said, "A man came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said, 'Messenger of Allah! I have relatives with whom I maintain ties while they cut me off. I am good to them while they are bad to me. They behave foolishly towards me while I am forbearing towards them.' The Prophet said, 'If things are as you said, it is as if you were putting hot ashes on them and you will not lack a supporter against them from Allah as long as you continue to do that.'"

2300530.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300530
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 007
2300530.text: 'Abdu'r-Rahman ibn 'Awf heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, said, 'I am the Merciful (ar-Rahman). I have created ties of kinship and derives a name for it from My Name. If anyone maintains ties of kinship, I maintain connection with him, and I shall cut off anyone who cuts them off.'"

2300540.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300540
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 008
2300540.text: Abu'l-'Anbas said, "I visited 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr at al-Waht (some land of his in Ta'if). He said, 'The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, pointed his finger towards us and said, "Kinship (rahim) us derived from the All-Merciful (Rahman). When someone maintains the connections of ties of kinship, they maintain connection with him. If someone cuts them off, they cut him off. They will have an unfettered, eloquent tongue on the Day of Rising."'"

2300550.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300550
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 009
2300550.text: 'A'isha reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Kinship (rahim) is derived from Allah. If anyone maintains ties of kinship Allah maintains ties with him. If anyone cuts them off, Allah cuts him off."

2300560.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300560
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 010
2300560.text: Anas ibn Malik reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Anyone who wants to have his provision expanded and his term of life prolonged should maintain ties of kinship."

2300570.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300570
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 011
2300570.text: Abu Hurayra heard that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "Anyone who wants to have his provision expanded and his term of life lengthened should maintain ties of kinship."

2300580.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300580
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 012
2300580.text: Ibn 'Umar said, "If someone fears his Lord and maintains ties of kinship, his term of life will be prolonged, he will have abundant wealth and his people will love him."

2300590.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300590
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 013
2300590.text: Ibn 'Umar said, "Whoever has taqwa of his Lord and maintains ties of kinship, his term of life will be prolonged, his wealth will be abundant, and his family will love him."

2300600.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300600
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 014
2300600.text: It is reported that al-Miqdam ibn Ma'dikarib heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "Allah enjoins you to be dutiful to your mothers. Then He enjoins you to be dutiful to your mothers. Then He enjoins you to be dutiful to your fathers. Then He enjoins you to be dutiful to your next closest relative and then to your next closest relative."

2300610.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300610
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 015
2300610.text: Abu Ayyub Sulayman, the mawla of 'Uthman ibn 'Affan, said, "Abu Hurayra came to us on a Thursday evening, the night before Jumu'a. He said, 'Every individual who severs ties of kinship is constricted when he leaves us. No one left until he had said that three times. Then a young man went to one of his paternal aunts with whom he had severed ties two years previously. He went to her and she asked him, 'Nephew! What has brought you?' He replied, 'I heard Abu Hurayra say such-and-such.' She said, 'Go back to him and ask him why he said that.' Abu Hurayra said, 'I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "The actions of the children of Adam are presented before Allah Almighty on Thursday evening, the night before Jumu'a. He does not accept the actions of someone who has severed ties of kinship."'"

2300620.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300620
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 016
2300620.text: Ibn 'Umar said, "Nothing that a man spends on himself and his family, anticipating a reward from Allah, will fail to be rewarded by Allah Almighty. He should begin with those whose support is his responsibility. If there is something left over, he should spend it on his next nearest relative and then the next nearest. If there is still something left over, he can give it away."

2300630.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300630
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 017
2300630.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Awfa reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Mercy does not descend on a people when there is someone among them who severs ties of kinship."

2300640.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300640
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 018
2300640.text: Jubayr ibn Mu'tim reported that he heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "The one who severs ties of kinship will not enter the Garden."

2300650.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300650
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 019
2300650.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Ties of kinship (rahim) is derived from the All-Merciful (ar-Rahman). They say. 'My Lord! I have been wronged! My Lord! I have been cut off! My Lord! I have! I have!' Allah answers them, 'Are you not content that I cut off the one who cuts you off and I maintain connections with the one who maintains connections with you?'"

2300660.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300660
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 020
2300660.text: Sa'id ibn Sam'an heard Abu Hurayra seeking refuge from the power of children and fools. Sa'id said, "Ibn Hasana al-Juhani told me that he asked Abu Hurayra, 'What is the token of that?' He replied, 'That he severs ties of kinship, obeys someone who is in error, and disobeys the correct guide.'"

2300670.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300670
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 021
2300670.text: Abu Bakra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "There is no wrong action which Allah is swifter to punish in this world - in addition to the punishment which He has stored up for the wrongdoer in the Next World - than cutting off ties of kinship and injustice."

2300680.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300680
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 022
2300680.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The one who maintains ties of kinship is not the one who reciprocates. The one who maintains ties of kinship is the one who, when his relatives cut him off, maintains ties of kinship."

2300690.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300690
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 023
2300690.text: Al-Bara' said, "A bedouin came and said, 'Prophet of Allah! Teach me an action which will enable me to enter the Garden.' He said, "The question is a broad one, even though you have asked it in only a few words. Free someone. Set a slave free.' He said, 'Are they not the same thing?' 'No,' he replied, 'Freeing someone is setting someone free yourself. Setting a slave free is to contribute to the price of setting him free. Lend an animal for milking which has a lot of milk and treat your relatives kindly. If you cannot do that, then command the good and forbid the bad. If you cannot do that, then restrain your tongue from everything except what is good."

2300700.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300700
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 024
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 024
2300700.text: Hakim ibn Hizam said to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, "Do you think that the acts of worship which I used to do in the time of the Jahiliyya - maintaining relations with relatives, setting slaves free and sadaqa - will bring me a reward?" Hakim said that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "When you become Muslim, you keep the good actions you have already done."

2300710.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300710
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 025
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 025
2300710.text: Ibn 'Umar said, "'Umar saw a silk robe for sale. He said, 'Messenger of Allah, would you buy this robe and wear it on Jumu'a and when delegations visit you?' He replied, 'Only a person who has no portion in the Next World could wear this.' Then the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was given some robes made of the same material. He sent one of the robes to 'Umar. 'Umar exclaimed, 'How can I wear it when you said what you said about it?' The Prophet replied, 'I did not give it to you so that you could wear it. You can sell it or give it to someone.' 'Umar sent it to one of his half-brothers by his mother who was still an idolater." (see 26)

2300720.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300720
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 026
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 026
2300720.text: Jubayr ibn Mut'im said that he heard 'Umar ibn al-Khattab say on the minbar, "Learn your lineages so that you can maintain ties of kinship. By Allah, if there are some bad feelings between a man and his brother and he knows that there is kinship between him and that man, that will prevent him from breaking with him."

2300730.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300730
In-book reference  : Book 2, Hadith 027
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 2, Hadith 027
2300730.text: Ibn 'Abbas said, "Keep a record of your lines of descent so that you can maintain ties of kinship. He will not make his relatives distant when they are close relatives, even if they live far away. He will not consider them to be close relatives if they are distant ones, even if they live near to him. Every time of kinship will come on the Day of Rising in front of each individual and testify on his behalf that he has maintained that tie of kinship if he did indeed maintain it. It will testify against him that he cut if off if he cut it off."
